result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher C Kyrola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Schedule IV Drugs, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(i).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with Steve E. or Lisa S.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher C Kyrola

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Agreement reached. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver. State to file Informatilon w/in 48 hrs. Def pleads guilty to count #2 of amended complaint; is convicted and sentenced. Counts #1 and #3 are dismissed and read in.
Hearing on September 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Matter before the court on updated report on defendant's competency status. Counsel and defendant have reviewed the report; all stipulate to the report and concur with its findings. Def concurs with report and waives hearing on competency. Court finds defendant is competent to proceed. Atty Armbrust request time to PT and attempt to resolve.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Court finds defendant is not competent and orders him committed for not to exceed 12 mos. Def is referred to OCRP. Matter adj day to day.
